titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Esther Ada Naylor Dance Card Collection 1930-1931
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kellyn Younggren

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Kellyn Younggren 2014

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Esther Ada Naylor dance card collection
did.abstract: Esther Ada Naylor attended the University of Montana-Missoula from 1930 to 1931, eventually receiving her teaching certification. This collection contains dance cards she acquired at University-sponsored social functions.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Esther Ada Naylor was born in Cimarron, Kansas on May 11, 1910. Her family moved to Crow Agency, Montana in 1906. She attended the University of Montana-Missoula from 1930 to 1931 and received her teaching certification. Naylor taught at several schools in Big Horn County, Montana. On June 7, 1934, she married Joseph Torske of Hardin, Montana. The couple would have four children and raise them on their farm near Hardin. Joseph passed away in 1970; Esther Ada died in 1995.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains 11 dance cards collected by Esther Ada Naylor during her time at the University of Montana-Missoula.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and The University of Montana-Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes.

prefercite.p: [Description and date of item], Esther Ada Naylor Dance Card Collection, Archives and Special Collections, Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula.

custodhist.p: All materials were in possession of Esther Ada Naylor until her death, at which point they transferred to her daughter Sandra Wigdahl who donated them to Archives and Special Collections in February 2013.

accruals.p: No future additions to this collection are expected.

processinfo.p: Items were rehoused in a folder.

relatedmaterial.p: Dance cards from University of Montana events can also be found in other collections at Archives and Special Collections including: the Sadie Erickson Scrapbook, Mss 659; the Fred E. Buck Scrapbook, Mss 657; the Mary Elrod Ferguson Papers, Mss 205; the Cora Averill Scrapbook, Mss 273; and the Beta Delta Chapter of the Sigma Chi Scrapbook, Mss 636.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
